intro: Phaeomeria hemisphaerica, commonly known as the globe cress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, globular shape and small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided and covered in a fine layer of white waxy powder. Phaeomeria hemisphaerica is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and hardy nature.
